user.rawDescription:
A Romani Rights & Visibility Effort. 
Podcast on vacation but posting will continue.

rawContent:
They don’t see us beyond you. And we’re already invisible half the time. 

We are a beautiful culture. We are amazing people. But we are our own. 

Please consider this when waking up and putting on your Gypsy mask.

user.rawDescription:
A Romani Rights & Visibility Effort. 
Podcast on vacation but posting will continue.

rawContent:
But how does it lead to erasure and cultural death? 

People see these fake Romani who are walking sterotypes, or use Gypsy Vibes and Gypsy soul. And they forget the real people behind it. Or didn’t know in the first place.

user.rawDescription:
A Romani Rights & Visibility Effort. 
Podcast on vacation but posting will continue.

rawContent:
Because you take Gypsy off when it’s inconvenient. We can’t. 

Even if we could, we wouldn’t. Our parents fought for our survival so we fight for our betterment. 

What do you fight for when you pretend to be Romani? The right to say Gypsy? To be seen as exotic and mysterious?

user.rawDescription:
A Romani Rights & Visibility Effort. 
Podcast on vacation but posting will continue.

rawContent:
We see starvation, we see angry faces turning away our children from schools, us from jobs, we see police with hatred on their faces. Disgust seething. 

You never have to deal with that as a fake Gypsy. You never have to endure the suffering our parents, grandparents, we face.

user.rawDescription:
A Romani Rights & Visibility Effort. 
Podcast on vacation but posting will continue.

rawContent:
We are a beautiful culture of diverse, strong and sadly extremely oppressed people. 

You see carefree, living on the road, no rules, no boss, free spirit boho Gypsy queen. 

That’s a fallacy painted to look like us, but has nothing to do with us.

user.rawDescription:
A Romani Rights & Visibility Effort. 
Podcast on vacation but posting will continue.

rawContent:
The amount of fake Romani on tiktok and other social media platforms is growing by the second. 

You cannot wake up one morning and decide “I think I’ll be a Gypsy”. 

It’s appropriation, erasure, and leads to cultural death. 

Don’t see how? 🧵
